content: can sew each arm to the body do not stuff the rest of the arm sew arms to body just below the neck where shoulders would be page 4 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com little legs make 2 row instruction stitches i ve found when changing colors frequently as in these legs it helps to make a cleaner row if you work the first row of each new color in the back loops only it makes for less bleeding of each color into the other if this is too hard for you though feel free to skip that instruction 1 using white 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 switch to black don t cut white at this point you ll be using it again in a moment 2 in blo 12 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 3 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 4 *decrease over next 2 single_crochet* around 6 cut black and change back to white at the end of this row 5 in blo 6 work even stuff the hand firmly at this point cut white and change to your skin color at the end of this row 6 in blo 6 work even 7 work even 6 8 work even 6 9 work even 6 10 work even 6 11 work even 6 12 work even 6 change to your short color at the end of this row 13 work even 6 14 work even 6 15 work even 6 slip_stitch join and bind off leave a tail about 8 long so you can sew the legs to the body do not stuff the rest of the leg sew legs to body at the front / bottom of the body see pictures shoe laces using 2 strands of a white 4-ply yarn weave through the front of the shoe to make it look like shoe laces tie a bow page 5 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together all of little boy s pieces laid out together here is little boy with his head sewn to his body and his arms sewn on in the row below his neck be sure to center the arms on each side of the hat brim page 6 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com if you want little boy to stand up or to look like he s walking or standing sew his legs on between row 1 and 2 of his body if you want him to sit on a shelf easier sew them on between row 3 and 4 the feet / shoes with and without shoe laces just lace the white thread i like to use 2 strands of a 4 ply yarn for detail sewing to look like shoe laces it s a small foot so 2 x s should be more than enough
